ClientModel

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientModel.Agent

  • public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    Purpose: A representation of an agent (pedestrian). It has X-Y start and goal positions as well as predetermined speed. An agent will only move towards its goal destination, and it will try to avoid colliding with other agents, either of its same colour or of the opposite colour.
    Version:
    2.0 29/01/2018
    Author:
    Amin Yassin

    • Constructor Detail

      • Agent

        public Agent(java.lang.String colorID)
        Constructor of an Agent (pedestrian). Y start and goal positions are randomized between 120.0 and 570.0. Speed is also randomized between 0.1 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        colorID - This color string must only be either blue or orange.

    • Method Detail

      • getPosX

        public float getPosX()
        Returns the X position of the Agent.
        Returns:
        The current X position.

      • setPosX

        public void setPosX(float posX)
        Sets the new X start positions of an agent that has reached its goal previously.
        Parameters:
        posX - The new X start position.

      • setPosY

        public void setPosY(float posY)
        Sets the new Y start position of an agent that has has reached its goal previously.
        Parameters:
        posY - The new Y start position.

        Parameters:

      • moveDownAndBack

        public void moveDownAndBack()
        A method the changes the direction of an agent relative to other agents that are in a collision direction to it.
        The naming of this method is correct only if the left side of the application window is considered as a reference point.

      • moveUpAndBack

        public void moveUpAndBack()
        A method the changes the direction of an agent relative to other agents that are in a collision direction to it.
        The naming of this method is correct only if the left side of the application window is considered as a reference point.

        public void moveUpAndForth()
        A method the changes the direction of an agent relative to other agents that are in a collision direction to it.
        The naming of this method is correct only if the left side of the application window is considered as a reference point.

        public void moveDownAndForth()
        A method the changes the direction of an agent relative to other agents that are in a collision direction to it.
        The naming of this method is correct only if the left side of the application window is considered as a reference point.

      • moveToGoal

        public void moveToGoal()
        An agent checks its distance to goal and moves towards it.
